alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:15PM CDT until March 27 at 4:13PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Petit Jean River At Danville. * WHEN...From this evening to Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the river are flooded. Portions of Corinth Road, north of Danville, become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning, March 26. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Crest Time Date Petit Jean River Danville 20.0 20.3 Fri 9 PM 21.8 18.6 17.6 22.2 7 PM 3/25 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
